    <metadata>
      <schema>http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM</schema>
      <lom xsi:schemaLocation="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/lomv1.0/lomLoose.xsd" xmlns="http://ltsc.ieee.org/xsd/LOM">
        <general>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>oai</catalog>
            <entry>oai:melt.cup.cam.ac.uk:cahi1:data_109804</entry>
          </identifier>
          <identifier>
            <catalog>lre</catalog>
            <entry>cahi1:data_109804</entry>
          </identifier>
          <title>
            <string language="en">Structure of cellulose</string>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Struktur von Zellulose</string>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Structure de cellulose</string>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Estrutura da celulose</string>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Struttura di cellulosa</string>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Δομή της κυτταρίνης</string>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Estructura de la celulosa</string>
          </title>
          <description>
            <string language="en">This illustration shows the structure of cellulose that is made up of beta-glucose molecules lined up to form 1,4 link (top). Also shown are the glycosidic bonds (coloured bonds) between the beta-glucose units (bottom).</string>
          </description>
          <language>x-none</language>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">beta-glucose</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">cellulose</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">condensation</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">glycosidic bonds</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">hydroxyl groups</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">polymer</string>
          </keyword>
          <keyword>
            <string language="en">polysaccharides</string>
          </keyword>
          <structure>
            <source>structureValues</source>
            <value>atomic</value>
          </structure>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-de">Diese Abbildung zeigt die Struktur von Zellulose,
die die Beta-Glukose Moleküle besteht, die ausgerichtet werden, um 
Link 1.4 (Oberseite) zu bilden. Auch gezeigt die Glykosid- 
Bindungen (farbige Bindungen) zwischen den Beta-Glukose Maßeinheiten 
(Unterseite).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-fr">Cette illustration montre la structure de la 
cellulose qui se compose des molécules de bêta-glucose alignées 
pour former le lien 1.4 (dessus). En outre montrées sont les 
obligations glycosidiques (obligations colorées) entre les unités 
de bêta-glucose (bas).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-pt">Esta ilustração mostra a estrutura da celulose 
que é composta das moléculas do beta-beta-glucose alinhadas até a 
ligação do formulário 1.4 (alto). São mostradas também as 
ligações glycosidic (ligações coloridas) entre as unidades do 
beta-beta-glucose (fundo).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-it">Questa illustrazione mostra la struttura di 
cellulosa che si compone delle molecole del beta-glucosio allineate 
per formare 1.4 il collegamento (parte superiore). Egualmente 
sono indicati i legami glicosidici (legami colorati) fra le unità del
beta-glucosio (parte inferiore).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-el">Αυτή η απεικόνιση εμφανίζει τη δομή της κυτταρίνης 
που αποτελείται από τα μόρια βήτα-γλυκόζης που παρατάσσονται στη
μορφή 1.4 τη σύνδεση (κορυφή). Επίσης εμφανίζονται οι 
glycosidic δεσμοί (χρωματισμένοι δεσμοί) μεταξύ των μονάδων 
βήτα-γλυκόζης (κατώτατο σημείο).</string>
          </description>
          <description>
            <string language="x-mt-es">Esta ilustración muestra la estructura de la 
celulosa que se compone de las moléculas de la beta-glucosa alineadas
para formar la conexión 1.4 (tapa). También se muestran los 
enlaces glucosídicos (enlaces coloreados) entre las unidades de la 
beta-glucosa (fondo).</string>
          </description>
